steps.title: First time setup for DMS in TeamPod
steps.description:
For first-time setup, please follow and complete all the steps below in same order to ensure proper security and document management:

1. Sign up for TeamPod
2. Create a Subscription
3. Create Teams
4. Create Designations
5. Create Job Locations
6. Create Users
7. Add Users to Teams
8. Create a company and add team members

steps.title: Log-in
steps.description: Log in to TeamPod application with your given credentials.

steps.title: Access profile
steps.description: Click on your profile name on top-right a dropdown opption will be available click on subscription.

steps.title: Admin dashboard
steps.description: An admin dashbord as shown in image will appear it will give you list of your active Subscriptions, to create a new subscription click on "Add new subscription" button.

steps.title: Plan
steps.description: You will see list of diffrent plan provided by TeamPod application click on "Create Subscription" button for the DMS plan.

steps.title: Subscription name
steps.description: Give a proper subscription name and click on "Create Subscription" button it will apper in TeamPod's DMS section.

steps.title: User management
steps.description: Give a proper subscription name and click on "Create Subscription" button it will apper in TeamPod's user management section.

steps.title: View Teams
steps.description: Click on 'Teams' to view the list of existing team names.

steps.title: Add a New Team
steps.description: Click on 'Add Team' and enter the team name.

steps.title: Save Team
steps.description: Fill out all information and click on 'Create' to add the new team, which can be selected when creating or editing a user.

steps.title: Create and manage job location field
Job Locations
steps.description: Click on 'Job Location' to view, update, or add a new Job Location field.

steps.title: New Job Location
steps.description: To add a new Job Location, click on 'New Job Location'

steps.title: Save
steps.description: Enter the location name and click on 'Create.' This will add a new Job Location, which can be selected when creating or editing a user.

steps.title: View Designations
steps.description: Click on 'Designation' to view the list of existing designations.

steps.title: Add a New Designation
steps.description: Click on 'New designation' and enter the designation name

steps.title: Save Designation
steps.description: Click on 'Create' to add the new designation, which can be selected when creating or editing a user.

steps.title: Access the Manage User Option
steps.description: On the left side of the vertical navigation bar, as highlighted in the image below, there will be an option labeled 'User Management.' Click on it to proceed.

steps.title: Select the Subscription
steps.description: It will show you the list of active Subscriptions added in your TeamPod account, select in which you want to create a new user.

steps.title: Navigate to the Users Section
steps.description: After selecting the organization, four options will be displayed: Users, Teams, Job Locations, and Designations. Click on 'Users' to proceed.

steps.title: Create, View and Export Active Users
steps.description: After clicking on 'Users,' a new window, as shown in the image below, will appear. This window displays the complete list of active users, which can also be exported to an Excel file. Click on 'New User' to create a new user.

steps.title: Fill Out User Details
steps.description:
Fill out all the required information for the user you want to create. If Teams, Job Locations, or Designations are not available in the dropdown menu, please refer to one of the following options for guidance

  • How to create and manage job location field
  • How to create and manage Designations
  • How to create and manage Team names.

steps.title: Save and Proceed
steps.description: Once you have reviewed the information, click on 'Save and Next' if you wish to add more users, or 'Save and Close' if you do not wish to add more.

steps.title: User Creation Confirmation
steps.description:
The new user will be created, and an email containing the login link and credentials will be sent to the user's email. 

  • How to log in to TeamPod

steps.title: Add existing user in to teams
Teams
steps.description: Click on 'Teams' to view and manage the teams

steps.title: view and manage teams
steps.description:
Select the name of an existing team or create a new team name.

To create a new team name, follow the steps outlined in the guide on how to create a new team name field.

steps.title: Add Team Member
steps.description: Click on the 'Add Team Member' button. This will open a new window displaying a list of active users.

steps.title: Add user
steps.description: Select the users you want to add and assign the appropriate role. Please note that only existing users can be added to a team. If the user has not been created yet, they will not appear in the list. In that case, please refer to the guide on how to create and manage users.

steps.title: Create companies and add user to it
Document Management
steps.description: Click on the 'Document Management' button in the left navigation bar, as shown in the image below.

steps.title: View companies
steps.description: Click on 'Companies' to view or add new companies.

steps.title: Select compnies
steps.description: Select the company to which you want to add team members. Click on 'Add Company' if you want to add a new company.

steps.title: fill out information
steps.description: Fill in all required information for the company and click on "Create".

steps.title: Add Team Member
steps.description: Click on the 'Add Team Member' button to add new team members.

steps.title: Add
steps.description: Search for the name of the member you want to add and Click on "Add" button to to add the team member.

steps.title: Access level
steps.description: Select the level of access by checking the appropriate checkbox, then click "Save".

steps.title: Home page
steps.description: Click on Document view button

steps.title: Upload
steps.description: Click on "Upload New Document" button

steps.title: Select files
steps.description: You can change the company name from the dropdown. Click on 'Select File.' This will open Windows Explorer, where you can select one or multiple invoices to upload.

steps.title: View file
steps.description: Once the invoices are selected, they will be displayed as shown in the image. click on upload

steps.title: Confirmation
steps.description: Wait for the confirmation message, then click 'OK.' The invoices will be uploaded and can be found under the 'Upload' stage on the homepage.

steps.title: Home page
steps.description: Expand the 'Uploaded' stage to view the invoices that have been uploaded and need to be processed.

steps.title: Select invoice
steps.description: Click on the invoice from the list that you want to process.

steps.title: Save Changes
steps.description: The data will be automatically filled out by the OCR. Review it and click on the highlighted button to save the invoice. Once saved, the invoice will be moved from the 'Uploaded' stage to the 'In-Process' stage.

steps.title: Home page
steps.description: Expand the 'In-process' stage to view the invoices that have been processed and needs approval.

steps.title: Select invoice
steps.description: Click on the invoice from the list that you want to send for approval

steps.title: Authorisation
steps.description: Review all the information once and click on the 'Send' button. It will prompt you to select the name of the authorising member.

steps.title: Select
steps.description: Select the name of the authorising person, add a comment or use the default comment, and click 'Send'.

steps.title: Confirmation
steps.description: The invoice is sent for approval. If the invoice is approved, it will move to the 'Received for Review' stage. If it is rejected, it will move to the 'Authorisation Rejected' stage. You can view the invoice under the 'Authorisation Request Sent' stage.

steps.title: Approve or Reject an Authorisation Request
Document View
steps.description:
TeamPod provides a comprehensive list of stages and corresponding document counts within each stage.

As an Authorizing Person, your primary focus will be on two key stages:

  1. Authorisation Requested – This stage displays all invoices awaiting your approval.
  2. Query Received – This stage lists invoices that have been sent to you for clarification.

You may also see other stages where invoices related to locations under your management have been assigned to another team member. These are for your information only, and no action is required from you. Examples include:

  • Authorisation – Displays invoices from your location that have been sent to another member for approval.
  • Query – Lists invoices from your location where a query has been raised by another team member.

steps.title: Authorisation requested
steps.description: In the Document View under the Authorisation Requested stage, you will see a list of invoices sent to you for approval or authorization. Click on the invoice you wish to process further

steps.title: Actions
steps.description:
Review the details carefully, and you will have three options:

  1. Approve the invoice.
  2. Reject the invoice.
  3. Transfer the invoice to another person if you believe they should handle the approval.

steps.title: Approving
steps.description: Click on Approve if you wish to approve the invoice.

steps.title: Approval confirmation
steps.description: On the confirmation pop-up, click Send to approve the invoice and return it to the person who requested the approval.

steps.title: Rejecting
steps.description: Click on the Reject Request button if you want to reject the invoice.

steps.title: Comments
steps.description: If needed, add comments to provide a reason for rejecting the invoice, then click Send to confirm.

steps.title: Transfer Request
steps.description: Click on the Transfer Request button if you believe this invoice should be reviewed by someone else on the team.

steps.title: Select user
steps.description: Select the user to whom you want to transfer the approval request. Add any comments if necessary, or check the Default Message box, then click Send to complete the transfer.
First, go to the Document View section of the system. Locate and click on the document you want to reject or Mark as incorrect.

If the document contains errors or inaccurate information, click the "Reject" button as highlighted in the image below. This action will reject the document entirely, and it will no longer be available for any further processing.

Note: This is different from rejecting an approval request for a document. In this case, you are marking the document itself as incorrect, not just declining its approval.

If you are looking for how to reject an approval request, please [click here].
It is recommended to provide a comment or reason for the action taken to ensure clarity and maintain proper documentation.
After a successful rejection, a confirmation pop-up window will appear as shown in the image below. You will need to refresh the page to proceed further.

steps.title: Homepage
steps.description: Log in to your TeamPod account, then click on your profile icon at the top-right corner. From the dropdown menu, select "Email Notifications."

steps.title: Select Notification
steps.description: You’ll see a list of notification types. Use the toggle switch next to each type to turn it on or off based on your preference.once you’ve made your adjustments, scroll down and click "Save Notifications" to apply the changes.

steps.title: Conformation
steps.description: Once saved you will see a confirmation pop as below.

steps.title: Email Template
steps.description: Below is a sample email template you may receive based on the types of notifications you’ve enabled.

steps.title: Enable Email Upload Option
steps.description: The email upload feature is turned off by default. To enable it, begin by clicking on your profile icon located at the top-right corner of the screen. A dropdown menu will appear. From this menu, select the "Email Notification" option. On the following screen, locate the email upload setting and enable it.

After selecting the "Email Notification" option, locate the "DMS Email Upload" setting and toggle it to enable the feature. Once enabled, scroll down and click on the "Save Notification" button to apply the changes, as illustrated in the image below.
Note : You will be only able to upload invoice if you have appropriate permissions.

After saving the settings, ensure that the correct email address is updated in the company's settings. If the email address has not been set, follow the steps below to add it.

Please note that the email address can only be added once. Any changes after the initial setup will require raising a support ticket.

Click on the Document Management button, as shown in the image below. This will open a sidebar displaying your available teams. Select the team for which you want to make the changes.

This will display a list of companies added under your selected team. Choose the company for which you want to add the email address, then click on the Edit Company button, as shown in the image below.

In the email address field, enter the name of the company (without spaces) or any other preferred name you would like to use as the email address, then click on Update.

This will add the email address to your company. Once added, you can send any document to this email address, and it will be uploaded to the system.
Note: Currently, only PDF files are supported.
To locate the uploaded document, click on Document View and navigate to the Uploaded stage. Here, you will find the document that was sent via email.
After opening the document, go to the Logs section. You will see a button labeled VIEW—clicking this will display the content of the email.

Below is an example of the content extracted from an email.

You will also receive an email notification indicating the status of the document whether it was successfully uploaded or if the upload failed.
